sub_topic: Calculation of Gibbs free energy change for a chemical reaction
message_1: What is the Gibbs free energy change for the formation of 2 moles of water molecules from hydrogen gas and oxygen gas at standard conditions (298 K and 1 atm pressure)? Give the answer in kJ/mol.
message_2:
To calculate the Gibbs free energy change (ΔG) for the formation of 2 moles of water molecules from hydrogen gas and oxygen gas at standard conditions, we need to use the following equation:

ΔG = ΔH - TΔS

where ΔH is the change in enthalpy, T is the temperature in Kelvin, and ΔS is the change in entropy.

The balanced chemical equation for the formation of water is:

2H₂(g) + O₂(g) → 2H₂O(l)

The standard enthalpy change (ΔH) for this reaction is -285.8 kJ/mol for the formation of 1 mole of water. Since we are considering the formation of 2 moles of water, the ΔH for this reaction will be:

ΔH = -285.8 kJ/mol × 2 = -571.6 kJ

The standard entropy change (ΔS) for this reaction can be calculated using the standard molar entropies of the reactants and products:

ΔS = ΣS(products) - ΣS(reactants)

The standard molar entropies for the substances involved in the reaction are:

S(H₂) = 130.6 J/mol·K
S(O₂) = 205.1 J/mol·K
S(H₂O) = 69.9 J/mol·K

Now, we can calculate the ΔS for the reaction:

ΔS = 2 × S(H₂O) - (2 × S(H₂) + S(O₂))
ΔS = 2 × 69.9 J/mol·K - (2 × 130.6 J/mol·K + 205.1 J/mol·K)
ΔS = 139.8 J/mol·K - (261.2 J/mol·K + 205.1 J/mol·K)
ΔS = -326.5 J/mol·K

Now, we can calculate the Gibbs free energy change (ΔG) using the equation:

ΔG = ΔH - TΔS

At standard conditions, the temperature (T) is 298 K. So, we have:

ΔG = -571.6 kJ - (298 K × -326.5 J/mol·K × 1 kJ/1000 J)
ΔG = -571.6 kJ + 97.3 kJ
ΔG = -474.3 kJ

Since we are considering the formation of 2 moles of water, the Gibbs free energy change per mole of water is:

ΔG per mole = -474.3 kJ / 2 = -237.15 kJ/mol

Therefore, the Gibbs free energy change for the formation of 2 moles of water molecules from hydrogen gas and oxygen gas at standard conditions (298 K and 1 atm pressure) is -237.15 kJ/mol.
